comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Associate Justice on the New York State Supreme Court; born in Hungary. www.courts.state.ny.us/courts/ad1/centennial/Bios/iwasser...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune., December 19, 1909, Page 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1909-12-19/ed-... announces his appointment as one of the assistants to district-attorney-elect Whitman. New-York tribune., November 05, 1914, Page chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1914-11-05/ed-... has him still as an assistant district attorney. New-York tribune., January 12, 1918, Page 14 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1918-01-12/ed-... has Wasservogel as a defense counsel. The bio pennylrichardsca linked to indicates that he was elected to the New York State Supreme Court in 1920.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In August 1915, it appears that he had been expected to be appointed to a vacant Supreme Court slot, but was passed over, according to NYT of August 22, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0E12F83C5D1773... NYT of December 29, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10813FE3B5B1773... reports his resignation as assistant district attorney and that he and another of the assistant district attorneys not staying on were to set up together in private law practice.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for your great research.
